reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at San Gallo during the first week in October. After a stressful drive, we found the hotel and were so incredibly happy when we saw our room. While the view from the room was nothing spectacular, the room itself was very large, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was enormous- the biggest one we stayed at during our 2 weeks in Europe. This was also probably the quietest room we stayed in during our vacation and we really needed it.
reviews.title: Our Favorite Hotel even if off the beaten path

likes.liked: — Ezzat the bartender, quiet clean room
likes.disliked: — Location was a little out of the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say enough about the staff at San Gallo. Luca at reception checked us in and gave us very specific directions to the parking garage. Then he was very helpful finding us a great, relaxing place to eat dinner at. Our favorite person, though was Ezzat the bartender. He was so friendly and had a lot of good advice about sites to see and food to eat. He also make excellent drinks with generous pours. We definitely would go back just to have a drink with Ezzat.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel, just wish location was slightly better

likes.liked: — Television programming services, room size & decor, modern amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is true that San Gallo is a little out of the way. It's definitely more than a 10 minute walk to the major sites. It took us about 15 minutes to get to the Piazza del Signoria but we actually enjoyed the walk so it wasn't a big deal for us.
reviews.title: Loved it, will stay again!

likes.liked: — Clean and comfortable room, friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Location (20 min walk from city center - it was ok for us, not sure if it would work for others)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: One other point is that the front desk recommended a little place called Alfredo's for pasta one night. It was nothing special and we would recommend finding another place if you can.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice

likes.disliked: — The numbering sequence for the rooms was a little confusing

reviews.title: Great Hotel, OK location
reviews.text: Overall, this was our favorite of 5 hotels during our 2 week adventure. We highly recommend it if you don't mind walking a bit and we would absolutely stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: What a surprise to find such a charming hotel in this bustling part of Florence. Although the hotel is not in the touristy area of Florence is was perfect for us to drive to and the nearby parking was also very useful. Access to the main tourist sites was just a 15 minute walk or a 7 min bus ride.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms and hotel were beautifully decorated and the surprising quiet. We really appreciated the menu of pillows! The staff were very friendly, especially Luca in reception. Breakfasts were excellent and it was great to be able to sit out on the terrace.
reviews.title: Clean but dull

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the best hotel of our trip and would be our first choice on any return trip.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006
reviews.text: We spent 3 days at the hotel and found it comfortable and clean although biggest gripe would be the location. The hotel is good twenty minutes walk from town (not the ten minute front desk advises!). The hotel is fairly new and has the atmosphere of busineess hotel which is a shame in a city with such a rich culture as Florence. First night our TV was broken - which they did not fix until the following day (no spare TV!) - but at least they fixed it promptly the following morning. The breakfast was disapointing considering the room rent.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel in perfect area
Ezzat the Magnificent !
reviews.text: We just came back from our honeymoon in Italy. We stayed @ San Gallo from Sept. 6 to 9, and had a great time in Florence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very nicely appointed, plush and comfortable. It's not terribly charming (it's quite modern in design and therefore somewhat generic) but is definitely a 4-star. The breakfast room and items served each morning were wonderful. Our 2nd floor room was on the back of the hotel and very quiet; we had a wonderful balcony that overlooked a courtyard garden. The bed was heavenly, and the TV offers travel tips, web access, etc.- a nice touch.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel and Location

likes.disliked: — It's modern decor, while attractive, lacked charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great. I was concerned that it might be too far from "the action", but was glad to be a bit removed from the crowds and noise of the Duomo area. Walking to the Duomo and Ponte Vecchio is a nice 20 minute stroll; to the Accademia, a 10 minute walk.
reviews.title: Loved the San Gallo Palace, Great Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Favorite parts of Florence: leather and scarf shopping in the street market area, eating lunch and taste-testing cheeses and various aged balsamic vinegars in the Central Market, getting away from the crowds by strolling through the peaceful and stately Boboli Gardens, dining at an outside cafe in the Piazza della Repubblica.
reviews.title: Walking distance to the Duomo and heart of Firenze

likes.disliked: — The only complaint could be that one heard the traffic at the busy traffic circle in front of the hotel during the day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The constant roar of the cars, buses and Vespas in Florence got to us a bit, so we took a fabulous day trip via bus to San Gimignano. While most tourists are flocking to Siena, this town is pure magic- no cars, medieval towers, and incredible views of the Tuscan landscape. This was our favorite day in Tuscany.
reviews.title: Love this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful place, the pictures are exactly like what you will see. The service in this hotel is outstanding, english easily spoken, and any needs quickly resolved. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We were able to walk to all the beautiful sights with no problem. Best to take a taxi upon arrival from the train station, with luggage it is not close. Our room had a balcony, which was great, but watch out for the mosquitos, they sneak in if you leave the door open. We requested a room with a shower which was like being in a car wash, total relaxation, there were four extra shower heads on the sides. The rooms were very clean and updated. The breakfast was the best we had during our stay in Italy, fresh and good quality. Make sure you get to see Florence from the top of the mountain where the church is, it is certainly a sight to see. If I were to go back, i would stay here again without a doubt!!
reviews.title: good value in the historical center

likes.liked: — the neat and cosy rooms decorated in a classic style
likes.disliked: — room no.83 which is very noisy because of the laundry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some may consider this out-of-the-way., but it is only about 1 mile from the major touristy area. We easily made the walk several times. We also took the bus (get tickets in Tabacchi shops) to Il Duomo, etc, which took about 5 minutes (use Via Camillo Cavour, use Via San Gallo to return). WARNING - try not to take the cabs because they will rip you off.
reviews.title: The San Gallo was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We visited the park (Giardino Orticultura) which was about 3 blocks from the hotel. Beautiful, relaxing, mostly locals, not crowded. The hotel staff recommended a trattoria which was about 3 blocks away. We had our best meals in Italy here. Friendly, mostly locals, not real expensive. There is also a great pastisseria just across the street. Great cookies and pasteries. There is an ATM just a block away.
reviews.title: All but the location
A "Palace" in Florence
reviews.text: WARNING - we booked several "tours" through C.A.F. (brochures at the front desk). I would not recommend these tours to anyone. Done on the cheap, impersonal, unprofessional. Ask the front desk about an alternative tour company.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was exceptionally nice and helpful. One downside - we had a front-facing room and could hear the traffic.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the San Gallo!

likes.liked: — Excellent room and bath, very quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006
reviews.text: We will stay here again when we return to Florence.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in June 07 as part of our honeymoon and found it to be a great hotel! Lovely rooms and fab bathroom and a real lovely retreat at the end of a busy day! Staff were very friendly and helpful and breakfast was good too.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only issues we had was the distance it was from the centre, we felt it was just too far out for us! Also the walls are quite thin so you can hear your neighbours if they are noisy
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled to Florence in early June to celebrate my husband's 40th birthday. I contacted the hotel on several occasions before we travelled to check room arrangements and to arrange pre-booked tickets for the 2 main galleries. The hotel couldn't have been more helpful - they replied quickly and arranged everything that I had asked for.
reviews.title: Solid Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel itself is just off a fairly busy piece of road, so I would recommend asking for room away from the road. We did and we couldn't hear any noise at all. The room was a good size, very clean and had all the usual mod cons. Although we didn't use it, the balcony was a good size and overlooked the gardens.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts were fantastic and had a great selection of pastries, cold meats, scrambled egg. All the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Little Gem

likes.liked: — Quality accommodation, close enough to all the main sites but far enough away to be quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel is 20 minutes by walk from the center, modern and pretty.
reviews.title: Good but...

likes.disliked: — Noises inside the room, from the other rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the amenities are normal for a 4* hotel.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One big point for me in an hotel is the noise, this one is terrible :(
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Impossible to sleep without those balls kies in your ears. The noises comes from inside so nothing with all the cars outside...
reviews.title: Definitely a little palazzo!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, comfortable room, peaceful location

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Also they forget to change towels till a long time, we found holes on it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks while doing day trips to the Tuscany region. Not only did we love our room, but the rest of the hotel was both cozy and elegant. The staff was both professional and personable, the breakfasts were excellent, the bar wonderful. We were supposed to stay at a different hotel at the tail end of our trip, which would have made it difficult seeing as we had accumulated our share of souveniers. :) The concierge not only found room for us to stay but called the other hotel as well to let them know we changed our plans. I woudn't stay anywhere else in Florence! Grazie!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful, comfortable, personable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I have stayed 3 times at the San Gallo Palace and consider the hotel a jewel. The hotel is fairly new and the beds are just a tad firm for my liking. In mentioning this in planning my last stay, they offered to wrap the mattress with a blanket for extra softness. They did exactly as they said they would, consistent with the service I've always experienced. Personally, I like the rooms with a view of the little courtyard garden. It is true that the hotel is a short walk from the center, but it is much quieter than the center, and if you wish not to walk, cab is inexpensive and bus service frequent. I've stayed at several places in Florence and find San Gallo Palace to be an excellent option if price, quality, and quiet are all of importance to you.
reviews.title: Service With a Smile

likes.liked: — Service, Room Quality, Breakfast on the Patio

reviews.title: I love this place!
reviews.text: I truly enjoyed my stay at San Gallo and will recommend anyone to stay here. It truly lives up to it’s 4 star quality.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To begin with, we only paid 83 euros a night for a Superior Double Room during the summer time. It was well worth it and a fantastic deal.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception area is very lovely and there is always some there attentive to your needs. The American bar is on the first floor and it has an indoor and outdoor sitting area. Besides drinks you can also order food. At our arrival we were given a welcome drink, which was an added bonus. The buffet breakfast was great and filling with different choices. The servers constantly came out to refill the trays through out the morning so there is plenty fresh food. It included fruit, pastries, cereal, breads, ham, cheeses, eggs, butter, jams, coffee, juices and milk.
reviews.title: Loved San Gallo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to Florence and most of the hotels that I viewed online seemed a little dated, so I was initially attracted to the fact that San Gallo was fairly new, breakfast was included and the website was attractive. I was celebrating my 40th birthday and the staff could not have been more helpful and pleasant in suggesting options (we plumped for a day trip to San Gimnignano & Siena - very good and arranged via the hotel in nanoseconds). Despite our plane landing an hour late, our hotel shuttle was waiting for us right outside arrivals. The room was spotless and a free pillow menu meant we could order our respective types of pillows (I'm a down girl - he's a firm man) to ensure that we slept like babies every night. A free welcome drink in the bar was offered and we chose to eat in one night which proved excellent also. Very good breakfast served until 10.30 with full English & Continental on offer. Good online access and a 15 minute walk to the Duomo & Uffizi means that this ticks every box. Bravo!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel & Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 5 nights in April 2007 at this hotel and it was excellent. Even before we had left the UK we had ontacted the hotel for their help on a few things and they replied quickly and helped us. Once we arrived they also took care of any questions and were spot on in all their advice on where and how to go about doing things, special thanks to Paulo who helped me get Fiorentina football tickets.
reviews.title: Excellent staff and good location
Decent...
reviews.text: The room was immaculate with excellent bathroom and facilities, including free safe, fridge, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was also good. Hot and cold buffet selection, fruit juice, coffee, the normal stuff, but very good.
reviews.title: Loved the San Gallo Palace!!

likes.disliked: — nothing,neither my partner or I could fault it...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is located opposite what was once a gateway into the city, and from here or a short walk away most buses can be accessed, including the No.7 which runs to Fiesloe and the amazing views across to Florence and its Cathedral.
reviews.title: Good Feel...
